channel.title: News - South China Morning Post
channel.description: All the latest breaking news from Hong Kong, China and around the world

item.title: Beijing signals importance of neighbours amid ‘growing weariness’ from the West
item.description: The leaders of Singapore and Malaysia both visited China last week in trips seen as showing ‘positivity in relations’.
item.dc:creator: Dewey Sim
item.author: Dewey Sim

item.title: How do you get a moose out of an Alaska medical facility? Very carefully
item.description: The hungry animal strolled through the building’s front doors and started munching on a potted plant in the lobby, online footage shows.
item.dc:creator: Tribune News Service
item.author: Tribune News Service

item.title: How will China’s Hainan free-trade port affect the Greater Bay Area and Asean?
item.description: China’s plan to turn Hainan into the world’s largest free-trade port by 2025 will – for the most part – be complementary to Hong Kong and Guangdong, and open up trade opportunities with Southeast Asia.
item.dc:creator: Seong Hyeon Choi,Luna Sun
item.author: Seong Hyeon Choi,Luna Sun

item.title: UK pop group S Club 7’s Paul Cattermole of dies at 46
item.description: The band behind early-2000s hits like Don’t Stop Movin’ and Never Had a Dream Come True had announced a reunion tour just weeks ago.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: 12-year-old and teen charged in Florida triple killing
item.description: The victims, also teenagers, were found along a roadside and in the boot of a partially submerged vehicle.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: France’s Macron ends trip to China with pact to bolster business, military ties
item.description: But the joint statement with Xi Jinping does not include a commitment from Beijing to use its influence to help end Russia’s war on Ukraine, a key Macron request.
item.dc:creator: Finbarr Bermingham
item.author: Finbarr Bermingham

item.title: Notorious arms dealer Viktor Bout urges Donald Trump to seek refuge in Russia
item.description: The notorious arms dealer, who was freed from a US jail last year, told the ex-US president to flee as his life was ‘in peril’.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Hours after Taiwan leader returns from US, China announces multi-day live-fire military drills
item.description: Exercises expected to take place in Taiwan Strait off coast of Fuzhou city on Saturday, with additional drills planned until April 20.
item.dc:creator: Orange Wang
item.author: Orange Wang

item.title: A two-point plan for peace in Ukraine – while Kyiv still holds some leverage
item.description: Ukraine has sustained massive losses of life and territory in the war, and may be disappointed if it expects Western countries to foot the reconstruction bill. A realistic settlement would involve Ukraine declaring itself a neutral state and Russia agreeing to fund reconstruction with assets frozen by Western countries.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Covany
item.author: Daniel Covany

item.title: Hong Kong police arrest massage parlour owner after girl, 17, says she was indecently assaulted
item.description: Teen told police she was molested during ‘free massage’ at parlour located in Hoi Luen Industrial Centre in Kwun Tong.
item.dc:creator: Kahon Chan
item.author: Kahon Chan

item.title: US and China urged to boost travel and exchanges to stop further fraying in ties
item.description: A study warns that relations have reached a ‘level of animosity not seen since the late 1960s’ and call for increased contact between the two sides.
item.dc:creator: Amber Wang
item.author: Amber Wang

item.title: Sickly Pope Francis to skip Good Friday procession for first time in a decade, due to cold weather and bronchitis
item.description: It is the first time the pope will not preside at the ‘Via Crucis’ service since he was elected in 2013. The last pope to do so was Pope John Paul II, during the last weeks of his life in 2005.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Travelling to South Korea just got much easier for 22 countries in Europe, North America and Asia
item.description: The K-ETA electronic travel authorisation, compulsory to enter without a visa, is now being waved for tourists from some countries – but only until December 31, 2024.
item.dc:creator: dpa
item.author: dpa

item.title: China took on outsized debt relief burden under G20 pandemic aid plan, study finds
item.description: China held only 30 per cent of the claims but backed 63 per cent of payment deferrals, according to the study by China Africa Research Initiative at Johns Hopkins University.
item.dc:creator: Jevans Nyabiage
item.author: Jevans Nyabiage

item.title: 95 per cent of approved applicants for Hong Kong talent scheme from mainland China, official figures show
item.description: As of end of February, 8,797 of applications approved, 463 rejected and 4,564 being processed.
item.dc:creator: William Yiu
item.author: William Yiu

item.title: Coronavirus: India urges states to ramp up testing as Covid-19 cases climb
item.description: On Friday, India saw the highest daily case count since September, so federal government urge states to dramatically increase testing.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Alibaba unveils ChatGPT alternative Tongyi Qianwen under cloud services after Baidu’s high-profile Ernie Bot launch
item.description: Alibaba is the latest Chinese tech firm to follow through with a home-grown alternative to ChatGPT weeks after a similar product from Baidu received a mixed reception.
item.dc:creator: Ben Jiang
item.author: Ben Jiang

item.title: Will new Philippine sites for US military near Taiwan affect Manila-China ties?
item.description: New EDCA sites key to country’s defence in the ‘strategic’ Luzon Strait against possible Chinese aggression in South China Sea, analysts say.
item.dc:creator: Raissa Robles
item.author: Raissa Robles

item.title: China and France make peace pledge on Ukraine as Macron caps trip with Xi meeting
item.description: In joint declaration, both countries agree to restart top-level talks and work together on global challenges.
item.dc:creator: Hayley Wong,Kawala Xie
item.author: Hayley Wong,Kawala Xie

item.title: Chinese hospital to carry out uterus transplants in clinical trial
item.description: Married women aged 18 to 40 with uterine infertility will receive donated wombs in study aiming to help them have their own children.
item.dc:creator: Echo Xie
item.author: Echo Xie

item.title: Saudi Arabia supports Pakistan with US$2 billion to help secure IMF deal
item.description: The pledge in external financing support is one of the final conditions for an IMF deal that Islamabad needs to secure funding for its economy, which is on the verge of collapse.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: More rich Chinese looking to donate amid Xi Jinping’s ‘common prosperity’ campaign, survey shows
item.description: About two thirds of Chinese with at least 5 million yuan (US$727,268) of investible assets say they want to keep donating to charity in the next 10 years, according to a new survey gauging attitudes towards philanthropy.
item.dc:creator: Mandy Zuo
item.author: Mandy Zuo

item.title: Jail for husband, traffickers in China’s ‘chained woman’ case
item.description: A year after Xiaohuamei was found shackled in a shed in appalling conditions, a court orders the people who sold her and kept her captive to between eight and 13 years behind bars.
item.dc:creator: Sylvie Zhuang
item.author: Sylvie Zhuang

item.title: Ex-Taiwan leader Ma Ying-jeou finishes tour of mainland China by warning island must ‘choose between peace and war’
item.description: Hs successor Tsai Ing-wen, who was in the US this week, said Ma’s vision was outdated and out of line with the current reality
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Chung
item.author: Lawrence Chung

item.title: Fewer applicants, more resignations for Hong Kong’s disciplined services over past 5 financial years
item.description: Number of applicants shrank 52 per cent from 93,300 in financial year ending March 31, 2019, to 44,400 in 2022-23.
item.dc:creator: William Yiu
item.author: William Yiu

item.title: Easter off to good start for Hong Kong residents and tourists hunting for fun ways to spend their holiday weekend
item.description: One of city’s biggest Easter egg hunts makes comeback after two years of online events.
item.dc:creator: Connor Mycroft
item.author: Connor Mycroft

item.title: Indonesia shaman’s arrest for at least 12 murders reignites serial killer concerns
item.description: 45-year-old Tohari – also known as Mbah Slamet – has confessed to some killings, police say, but does not recall the exact number of deaths or who all his victims were.
item.dc:creator: Aisyah Llewellyn
item.author: Aisyah Llewellyn

item.title: 7 Good Friday religious marches held across Hong Kong but most members told to keep faces visible
item.description: At one procession that stuck to church grounds, some participants wore masks, with one Christian saying rules impinge on right to practise religion.
item.dc:creator: Fiona Sun
item.author: Fiona Sun

item.title: Shadow cast over Japan’s space dreams after Virgin Orbit bankruptcy
item.description: Two Japanese companies emerged as among the top six creditors when UK billionaire Richard Branson’s space company went bankrupt this week.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: A woman stands up: rising Chinese feminist icon, actress Zhang Jingchu, celebrates admission to top US film school with rallying call to women
item.description: A top school in the US has admitted Chinese actress and a rising feminist icon, Zhang Jingchu, to study in their hallowed halls. Zhang has shared her joy at the news, inspiring women everywhere.
item.dc:creator: Fran Lu
item.author: Fran Lu

item.title: South Korea to offer US$5.3 billion to North America to support EV battery investment
item.description: Government support will lower lending rates, insurance premiums by up to 20 per cent and providing more loans and tax credits for Korean firms investing in US following Inflation Reduction Act.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: By putting business over politics, Hong Kong can lead China and France to stronger ties, entrepreneur says
item.description: Sunwah Group chairman Jonathan Choi Koon-shum says foreigners appreciate city’s ‘no strings attached’ approach to funding business and cultural projects.
item.dc:creator: Kinling Lo
item.author: Kinling Lo

item.title: 7 injured after truck collides with KMB bus and topples over in Hong Kong, trapping passengers
item.description: Firefighters rescue truck driver and two male passengers trapped in vehicle.
item.dc:creator: Laura Westbrook
item.author: Laura Westbrook

item.title: Hong Kong restaurants struggle as residents travel and mainland Chinese tourists stay home for Easter weekend
item.description: Catering industry will experience a 20 per cent drop in business between Friday and Monday compared with pre-Covid levels, federation boss says.
item.dc:creator: Cannix Yau,Wynna Wong
item.author: Cannix Yau,Wynna Wong

item.title: Thousands in Hong Kong queue up for cross-border shuttle to visit Macau in hopes of spending Easter long weekend in casino hub
item.description: By 9pm on Friday, 61,688 people had left city using Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau bridge checkpoint, a three-year high.
item.dc:creator: Edith Lin
item.author: Edith Lin

item.title: Ex-Google boss Eric Schmidt says pause on artificial intelligence research would ‘benefit’ China
item.description: More than 1,000 researchers have called for an artificial intelligence research pause of ‘at least six months over safety concerns.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: South China Sea: ex-PM Muhyiddin hits out at Malaysia’s Anwar over energy exploration negotiations with Beijing
item.description: Muhyiddin condemned Prime Minister Anwar’s announcement that his government was open to talks on Beijing’s concerns over Petronas’ exploration in the disputed waterway.
item.dc:creator: The Star
item.author: The Star

item.title: China opens leading laboratory focused on brain-machine interaction
item.description: Sixty scientists are working at the Tianjin lab, which the government hopes will drive innovation, according to official newspaper.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Chen
item.author: Stephen Chen

item.title: Children’s wards at Hong Kong hospitals overwhelmed amid flu surge, paediatrician warns after death of second patient under age of 18
item.description: University of Hong Kong’s Dr Patrick Ip attributes influx in patients to late arrival of flu season this year.
item.dc:creator: Willa Wu,Kahon Chan
item.author: Willa Wu,Kahon Chan

item.title: Mainland China sanctions US and Taiwanese institutes and individuals in retaliation for Tsai Ing-wen’s visit
item.description: The Hudson Institute and Ronald Reagan Presidential Library and senior executives are banned from entering or doing business in Beijing’s territory.
item.dc:creator: Minnie Chan
item.author: Minnie Chan

item.title: US, allies urge countries to repatriate North Koreans illegally working abroad to fund military
item.description: The nuclear envoys of the US, Japan and South Korea nations that host the labourers could be aiding in illegal activity.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: Helicopter debris found as Japan hunts for missing troops in Okinawa
item.description: The UH-60JA, carrying 10 people, disappeared from radar while on a reconnaissance mission in southern Okinawa’s Miyako island.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: ‘We gave it our all … nobody is talking about that’: Hong Kong men’s hockey team bemoans anthem blunder, fears for future if funding cut
item.description: ‘If our own government does not even support us, the sport will die out,’ says 20-year-old player.
item.dc:creator: Wynna Wong
item.author: Wynna Wong

item.title: Xi Jinping says ‘wishful thinking’ to expect Beijing to compromise on Taiwan
item.description: Chinese leader makes first public comment since Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen’s meeting with US House Speaker Kevin McCarthy.
item.dc:creator: Teddy Ng
item.author: Teddy Ng

item.title: ‘Secret’ documents detailing US and Nato’s Ukraine war plans are fake, presidential adviser says
item.description: ‘(Russia’s) intelligence services have degenerated to the point where they can only rehabilitate themselves with fake information,’ Ukraine’s Mykhailo Podolyak tweeted.
item.dc:creator: Business Insider,dpa
item.author: Business Insider,dpa

item.title: Death penalty easing a step towards ‘new Malaysia’ but worry over free pass for criminals remains
item.description: Malaysia’s move has raised hopes other Southeast Asian countries can follow suit.
item.dc:creator: Hadi Azmi
item.author: Hadi Azmi

item.title: US rapper XXXTentacion’s convicted killers sentenced to life in prison
item.description: The singer was shot to death outside a South Florida motorcycle in 2018.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Rise of the robots … in dining and retail: Hong Kong’s restaurants, shops turn to technology to beat manpower crunch
item.description: Technology is raising efficiency, cutting costs and making up for lack of workers in catering and retail industries.
item.dc:creator: Cannix Yau
item.author: Cannix Yau

item.title: ‘Bees hitch a ride’: millions marvel at coolness of Chinese ‘legend’ who calmly drives on as hundreds of honeybees swarm above his head inside car
item.description: A Chinese man who calmly carried on driving while hundreds of honeybees swarmed above his head in a hive they had made in his car has sparked shock and amazement among millions on mainland social media.
item.dc:creator: Fran Lu
item.author: Fran Lu

item.title: Morgan Stanley moves ahead with plan for wholly-owned futures company in China, as Beijing accelerates financial opening
item.description: Morgan Stanley’s aim for establishing its wholly-owned futures company in China has made some progress as Beijing officially accepted the application.
item.dc:creator: Iris Ouyang
item.author: Iris Ouyang
